sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has two parallel sides measuring 5 cm and 10 cm, and two non-parallel sides measuring 6 cm and 7 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium in centimeters?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add up the lengths of all four sides. 

Perimeter = (5 cm) + (10 cm) + (6 cm) + (7 cm) = 28 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 28 centimeters.
